decks.notes: This deck focuses on applying early pressure and disrupting opponents' strategies while utilizing powerful creature and equipment synergies. By leveraging cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Aether Vial to cheat in threats, along with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize to disrupt opposing game plans, this deck aims to maintain board presence and control throughout the game. With a mix of aggressive creatures, removal spells, and disruptive elements, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a proactive game plan while also being able to adapt to various matchups.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Death & Taxes strategy to disrupt opponents while also applying aggressive pressure. It aims to control the board with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, while also utilizing Aether Vial to cheat out creatures. The deck also includes powerful threats like Kaldra Compleat and Skyclave Apparition to close out games quickly. With a mix of disruptive elements and strong creatures, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victories through a combination of disruption and aggression.

The main focus of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Aggro - Canadian Threshold deck is to control the board through countering spells with Force of Will, Daze, and Pyroblast, while utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Questing Druid, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent to apply consistent pressure on the opponent. Card selection and manipulation through Ponder, Brainstorm, and Mishra's Bauble help to maintain card advantage and find key pieces. Wasteland is used to disrupt the opponent's mana base while the mana base itself is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's mana base and lock them out of casting spells with cards like Blood Moon, Chalice of the Void, and Magus of the Moon. The deck aims to ramp up its own mana with cards like Ancient Tomb and Simian Spirit Guide to cast powerful threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Sundering Eruption. It also utilizes cards like The One Ring and Fury for additional damage and control, creating a fast-paced and disruptive aggro strategy in the Legacy format.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor combo, allowing the player to mill their deck and put Thassa's Oracle onto the battlefield to win the game instantly. The deck includes cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to help dig for combo pieces, as well as counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. The inclusion of cards like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending also provides removal options to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this Death & Taxes Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down the opponent's strategy and Swords to Plowshares to deal with threatening creatures, the deck aims to maintain control of the battlefield. Additionally, cards like Starfield Shepherd and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide powerful synergies with enchantments and tokens, allowing the deck to quickly build a threatening board presence. The deck also includes mana acceleration and land destruction to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This Aggro Dragon Stompy deck aims to disrupt opponents' mana bases with cards like Blood Moon, Chalice of the Void, and Magus of the Moon while ramping up quickly with mana acceleration from cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide. The deck's main win condition is to apply pressure with powerful creatures like Fury and Broadside Bombardiers, supported by burn spells like Shatterskull Smashing and Sundering Eruption. Additionally, the deck includes card advantage engines like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Urza's Saga to maintain momentum and overwhelm opponents.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Entomb and Reanimate to cheat them into play early. Utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to find combo pieces and disruption, while also protecting the combo with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes some removal in Fatal Push and Brazen Borrower, as well as graveyard hate with Nihil Spellbomb. Overall, the goal is to quickly reanimate big threats and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond.

The main concept of this Elves combo deck is to ramp up quickly with mana-producing creatures like Heritage Druid and Nettle Sentinel, and then generate card advantage with Glimpse of Nature. By utilizing Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order, the deck can search for key combo pieces like Craterhoof Behemoth to end the game quickly. The inclusion of Allosaurus Shepherd provides protection against countermagic, while Wirewood Symbiote offers flexibility and synergy with other Elves in the deck. The overall goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of Elves and deliver a lethal blow with Craterhoof Behemoth.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead to quickly get powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield from the graveyard. Other cards like Force of Will, Daze, and Thoughtseize are included to protect and support the combo strategy. The deck also includes cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for card advantage and selection. The main goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disrupt their game plan with counterspells and hand disruption.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 deck revolves around utilizing the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom alongside cards like Nomads en-Kor and Chord of Calling to create explosive plays. The deck also includes various tutor cards like Green Sun's Zenith to search for key pieces, while also having protection in the form of cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Endurance. Gaea's Cradle provides additional mana acceleration to allow for faster combos, making the deck a formidable force in the format.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain control of the board while applying constant pressure on the opponent with efficient and aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Delver of Secrets. Utilizing disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect your threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan, while utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Brainstorm to dig for more threats and protect your own resources. The tempo of the deck is crucial, using cards like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning to deal direct damage and close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures, then using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a quick win. It also includes disruption in the form of counter spells like Force of Will and Daze, along with hand disruption like Thoughtseize to control the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to outpace and overwhelm opponents with powerful creature threats that can end the game in just a few turns.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bring them back into play for a game-winning combo. It uses cards like Entomb and Reanimate to cheat creatures into play, while also utilizing counterspells like Daze and Force of Will to protect its strategy. The combination of creature reanimation and control elements allows the deck to have explosive starts and protect its threats from removal, creating a powerful and resilient combo engine.

The deck revolves around quickly getting out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with these creatures, forcing them to deal with multiple threats at once. The deck includes additional protection with cards like Force of Will and Stock Up to ensure the combo goes off smoothly. The strategy is to rapidly assemble the combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can establish a defense.

This UWx Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage through various draw spells and planeswalkers. It utilizes counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its threats, while removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending handle opposing creatures. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to control the tempo of the game, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Thundertrap Trainer provide card advantage and selection. Back to Basics can shut down nonbasic lands, giving the deck a strong advantage in the long game.
